transcript: to the bullets whistling, singing, and hissing continu- ally around them. He spote in the tone of en- treaty and reproach that a carpenter uses to a gentleman who has picked up an ax: "We are used to it, but you, sir, will blister your hands." He spoke as if those bullets could not kill him, and his half-closed eyes gave still more persua- siveness to his words.
